intro: Melampyrum nemorosum subsp. debreceniense, commonly known as the Hungarian touch-me-not, is a flowering plant in the family Orobanchaceae. It is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it partially relies on host plants for water and nutrients. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as woodlands and grasslands. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive bilaterally symmetrical shape. It is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions, including North America.
